title: Piers Morgan admits Good Morning Britain poll has led to a pay rise
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Piers Morgan has admitted that Good Morning Britain viewers won’t be able to get rid of him despite an online poll calling for his dismissal from the show.

Over the past three days, the ITV daytime show has asked fans on Twitter to have their say in whether the host should be fired from his role over this views on gender and now the results are in.

A whopping 482,270 people voted in the poll with 60% opting for Piers to go and just 40% choosing for him to stay.

Despite the findings, Piers has ruled out leaving the show and added that the survey actually helped get him a pay rise.

Speaking to co-host Susanna Reid, he commented: ‘The poll was 80% in my favour after the day we ran it and then these weird people in Los Angeles, very, very demented, hysterical people, got hold of the poll and they’ve now turned it into a 60/40 split against me.

Piers Morgan thanked viewers for helping him get a pay rise (Picture: ITV)

‘Here’s the thing, I think they genuinely think they’re going to get rid of me and that’s what makes this more the funnier. You’re not going to get rid of me.’

‘How do they get rid of you?’ asked Susanna.

Piers replied: ‘I don’t think this has been worked through.

‘They think that making me trend worldwide for two days, ie making me the most talked-about breakfast presenter in the world, that is the way to get rid of me.’

He added: ‘Let me tell you what you’ve done, you’ve helped me get a pay rise. So, cheers. Cheers everybody.’

On top of the poll, there are also two online campaigns circulating online regarding Piers’ future on Good Morning Britain.

One Change.org petition has seen 22,309 people call for Piers’ removal while another has 46,288 people back his position on the show.

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays at 6am on ITV.
